alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 11:23PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Pulaski County through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1123 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hogue, or 9 miles northwest of Somerset, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Science Hill around 1130 PM EDT. Dabney and Bobtown around 1140 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Shopville, Valley Oak, Bent and Bloss. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
